reviews.review_msg: Professor Hrazdil is a great prof. His assessments are fairly marked. The class is seminar based, so a big part of your grade depends on how well you deliver your seminar. He also gives out 5 surprise quizzes, and they are pretty tough, so make sure you keep up with the readings. Overall, a solid class if you put in the work.
Honestly, he may come off as unapproachable but he's actually a really nice guy. Super straightforward! He will try and give you the best grade he can.

Although he did not teach as much as the seminars are group lead, his assessments were really really fair. He's lets you pick your groups so make sure you pick decent people to work with since half your grade is presentations.
Karel is one of the best profs I've ever hard. The course is difficult but he cares so much about the students and their understanding. Also super funny and entertaining. Highly recommend

Karel, is a great professor and really knows his subject matter but his content was taught as an accounting class where it was focused much more on company valuation and stock ratios rather than understanding the balance sheet of a business. Great guy and very clear with what you need to know for the assessment vs just good to know stuff.
Wondering how he can give the same % marks for all the assignments in a course. Not sure if he pays attention to the details.

A very passionate professor who loves the subject of accounting. At times, Karel can come off as stand-offish but he really does mean well. He is interested in improving students learning and helping them with hard projects. The presentations are very valuable for practicing presentation skills and allow for a deeper understanding of the material.
Great prof to hangout with after the semester (We went out for dinner) but the course is pretty useless...
He has great passion on teaching. Gave useful feedbacks for students to review on their seminars.

If you are not a native speakers, u will below the average. He is really bad. Do not take with him. Try other prof. He dont know how to teach, he just sit in the class from 1130-2020, and teach nothing. If you want to fail, try to take with him!!!
Don't take him. enough said

nice guy. very flexible with students. appreciate his effort to make accounting fun and relevant. however, lectures too quickly. can seem somewhat arrogant by saying that accounting is "easy". seems like the type that has favourites. overall, mehh

Took Business 321 and 421 with him. Truly is one of my favourite professor's at SFU. Knows the topic extremely well, and explains clearly what to expect for assignments/exams/papers. Further makes an effort to break down the Student/Teacher barrier which engages students in his class which subsequently helps you understand the course better.

Very nice guy, passionate about accounting. learnt a lot from him. class itself might be hard for some student but if you do all the in class examples and HW you will do fine. Lectures were extremely helpful. I would recommend taking class with him. FYI he got Phd in accounting when he was 26 years old.
fyi, he doesnt mark the exams/assignments himself...theres a desingated marker who got paid to do nothing but mark these stuff
teaching is meh. exam difficult is fair. has attitudes towards students for sure. i wonder why ppl say he's a good prof and passionate towards acct/teaching.
Funny commercials he plays during breaks are fun. Sadly, only reason I went to class...

This guy is truly a great accounting professor.  The class was easy with him.  He teaches really well, and with even minimal effort, you can do well in this class.  Also makes it fairly interesting and the exams cover material that is 100% expected from the lectures.  Take this class with this prof.!!!
Great Prof! Explain the concept clearly. I learn a lot from him. Also, he is very approachable and friendly to his students. He even tries to know every of his student's name.
Unbelievably fast marker. I think we got our midterm grades back in 1-2 days. Teaching is meh...

He drops a number of hints during lectures so it  pays to attend. I can't shake the impression that he rewards brown nosing. He was evasive and unwilling to answer questions about a class case study for our group but, more than helpful for another group's member who fawned over him relentlessly. Decent but, should watch the perception of favortism.
Great guy. Tries to get to know all his students. Lectures are never dull as he tries to make it entertaining via short clips, jokes..etc. Exams aren't easy tho and require a fair amount of studying.

Excellent prof. Makes course material easy to follow; offers tips and hints if you pay attention in lectures. Relates material very closely to the business world and even extracts f/s from corporations to illustrate the concepts better. All in all, very interesting and passionate prof. Layout of tutorials are also very well planned out.

Put in the work! If you attend lectures, understand tutorials, and do the self-study questions he assigns, you won't be surprised with the exam questions. Very clear and straightforward with what will be tested. Clear lectures, helpful slides, and open to questions. Likes people who participates on WebCT, I wouldn't call that brown-nosing.
No Comments
